group.instructions: The policy may state what characters, words, or pre-existing passwords may or may not be used when creating new passwords.

page.title: Instructions for Character Selection
page.instructions:
The policy’s statements about the selection of individual characters are addressed in the next three subsections:
– Character occurrence asks about the use of alphanumeric and special characters;
– Character positionasks about what characters may or may not be used at various locations within a password; and
– Character combination asks about specific combinations, sequences and patterns of characters.

group.title: Character Occurrence
group.instructions: Check all of the character types (e.g., upper case, numbers, etc.) mentioned in the policy regarding password creation, and answer the relevant questions for each type. The questions will ask whether those characters are prohibited or recommended against, and if not, whether the policy sets minimums or maximums for the number of times those characters can be present in a password.

group.title: Character Position
group.instructions: Policies might identify character types that may or may not be used at various positions in a password, including the first character, last character, internal characters, and first several characters. You will be asked to identify all of the conditions stated by the policy.
